intro: Pimelea lindleyana, commonly known as the yellow wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a member of the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters. Its leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, and it thrives in well-drained soils. Pimelea lindleyana is often found in heathlands and open forests, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitats.
